item.title: Tree falling and being left to grow for years now., 9th July
item.description:
Tree falling and being left to grow for years now. It is a risk issue for the kids, houses and fences around it. It is dangerously leaning down toward people. The next storm could definitely bring it completely down and kill someone.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Surlingham Close, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Open and caving in manhole cover, 9th July
item.description:
Incredibly dangerous open manhole cover in front of a place that is always filled with children coming in and out. It's very recent, maybe a couple of days, but I'm hoping it gets fixed quickly as there's a lot of foot traffic and someone can easily fall in as it looks like the manhole cover is caving in very badly.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Beresford Street, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Ruining my shed, 9th July
item.description:
The tree hasn't been touched since I moved in 6 years ago..It's grown considerably,over my property causing damage to the roof of my shed.. and the back fence of my garden..It is in the next close on a public foot path..Constant bird poo in my garden as they all seem to meet there..and constant bird noises including 2 owls chatting day and night..Please can it be cut back to not over lap my garden

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Timothy Close, Blendon, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Bike lane not practicable to ride, 9th July
item.description:
The trees fall so much on the bike lane that the bikes are rising on the pathway. There are also a lot of pot holes on the cycle lanes in the same area. Some riders fall on regular basis.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Central Way, Thamesmead, London

item.title: Uneven pavement, 9th July
item.description:
I would like to report an incident that occurred Sunday evening (22/06/25) between 8:30pm and 8:45pm. We was walking through the village and my daughter she was on her scooter riding along the pavement outside pink peppers on Albert road, Nuxley village Belvedere da17, when she fell off due to uneven pavement. I have reported this to Thames Water and they have advised me that this would be down to the local council. I am reporting this due the marks she now has on her face which has now left a scar, I tried speaking to shop owner but he wasnt caring or helpful at all My daughter was in pain not being able to sleep on that side of her face and even missed out in participate fully in her first sports day due to this injury. I have attached photos of her face and the reply from Thames Water

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 22, Albert Road, Upper Belvedere, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Broken manhole cover, 9th July
item.description:

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 220-222, Trafalgar Road, East Greenwich, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Remove "One off pay congestion charge option", & leave auto-pay congestion charge, 9th July
item.description:
Remove the one off payment congestion charge option - As it Confuses different types of people from diverse/different backgrounds and drivers with inadequate information can lead to too many PCNs for congestion charges they paid for one off by mistake not auto-pay - which is better as, it can be left & it won't work if a car isn't driven in the zones.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Queen Victoria Street, City of London
Report on FixMyStreet
